intro: Christella cana, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Christella cana is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 inches.
